paper_title.en: A new theory for high definition virtual acoustic display named ADVISE

description.en: A new theory for high definition Virtual Acoustic Display (VAD) based on a model called the "Virtual Sphere (VS) model" is introduced in this paper. This method is named ADVISE (Acoustic Display based on the VIrtual SpherE model). In ADVISE, a sphere-shaped boundary is defined around a listener, and the sound transmission from the sound source in the original field to the entrances of the listener's ears is divided into two parts. One consists of Head-Related Transfer Functions (HRTFs) corresponding to the points on the boundary of the virtual sphere, and the other consists of Room Transfer Functions (RTFs) from the sound source to the points on the boundary. Then, these two kinds of transfer functions are convolved in real-time, taking into account the dynamic changes in these functions due to the listener's head movement. The Kirchhoff-Helmholtz boundary integral equation is the theoretical basis of this idea. This equation represents that a sound field generated by sound sources outside a certain closed boundary can be synthesized by phantom monopole and dipole sources distributed on the boundary. In this paper, the theory of ADVISE is stated, then the features of ADVISE are described.

paper_title.en: Effects of visual information on auditory presence

description.en: The effects of visual information on auditory presence were presented. A segment with a duration of 15 s was used as a stimulus for presentation to a subject for each sound and its corresponding moving picture. The auditory pictures showed a marked change if the corresponding moving picture gave information on the original sound field correctly.

paper_title.ja: バイク用ヘルメット装着時における実音源の方向定位

description.ja: バイク用ヘルメットの装着が, バイク運転者による警笛音, 車輌の接近音などの到来方向に対する判断にどのような影響を及ぼすかを聴取実験によって調べた。ヘルメットは, 両耳を覆い, 音を遮断し, ヘルメット全体の振動を通して内部に音を伝えるため, 音源の認識や方向を誤らせる要因となる。聴取実験の結果は, 音源が被験者の前方にある場合に判定がやや良く, 側方や後方にある場合は判定が困難になる。また, ヘルメット装着時の方向判断は, 低い周波数帯域 (0.25, 0.5kHz) の音では, 遮音の影響よりもヘルメット内での反射や共振が方向定位に影響を与える。高い周波数帯域 (4, 8kHz) では, ヘルメット自体の遮音量が大きいことから, ラウドネスの低下が方向定位に強く関与していることが示された。
description.en: A listening experiment was carried out to investigate how a full-face motorcycle helmet worn by a motorcyclist affects his/her judgment about the arrival direction of an approaching vehicle through its sound and/or horn. Helmet reduces the loudness of sound by covering the ears and also transmits it to inner space of helmet through its vibration. These may cause misjudgment about the source of sound and its direction. The results of experiment show that sound localization is better for the frontal direction than for the side or the rear. Furthermore, sound localization was found to depend on source frequency, that is, the judgment is better for low frequency range (0.25, 0.5kHz) than for high frequency (4, 8kHz). This result may be due to the fact that the sound insulation of a helmet is greater in high frequency than in low frequency. On the other hand, a helmet can vibrate easily in lower frequency range than in higher one, and it disturbs the sound localization in low frequency region. On the basis of these findings, a new helmet with better sound localization is being developed.

paper_title.en: Elementary real-time implementation of a virtual acoustic display based on ADVISE

description.en: A new theory for high definition Virtual Acoustic Display (VAD) based on a model called the "Virtual Sphere (VS) model" is introduced in this paper. This method is named ADVISE (Acoustic Display based on the VIrtual SpherE model). In ADVISE, a sphere-shaped boundary is defined around a listener, and the sound transmission from the sound source in the original field to the entrances of the listener's ears is divided into two parts. One consists of Head-Related Transfer Functions (HRTFs) corresponding to the points on the boundary of the virtual sphere, and the other consists of Room Transfer Functions (RTFs) from the sound source to the points on the boundary. Then, these two kinds of transfer functions are convolved in real-time, taking into account the dynamic changes in these functions due to the listener's head movement. The Kirchhoff-Helmholtz boundary integral equation is the theoretical basis of this idea. This equation represents that a sound field generated by sound sources outside a certain closed boundary can be synthesized by phantom monopole and dipole sources distributed on the boundary. In this paper, the theory of ADVISE is stated, then the features of ADVISE are described.

paper_title.en: Comparison of loudness functions suitable for drawing equal-loudness-level contours

description.en: Five kinds of loudness functions were examined to determine a suitable function for drawing equal-loudness-level contours based on experimental data. First, equal-loudness relations were measured between 125-Hz and 1-kHz pure tones from 70 phons down to 5 phons and thresholds of hearing were measured at both frequencies. Then, five model equations expressing the equal-loudness relation were derived from the five loudness functions, and these equations were fitted to the data. The results showed that three of them could well explain the equal-loudness relation down to 5 phons. Among the three functions, the loudness function proposed by Zwislocki and Hellman [J. Acoust. Soc. Am., 32, 924 (1960)] and Lochner and Burger [7. Acoust. Soc. Am., 33, 1705-1707 (1961)] was regarded as the most appropriate function for drawing equal-loudness-level contours, because the number of parameters of the function was fewer than that in the other two and the threshold of hearing could be used for the fitting as a datum of the equal-loudness relation, resulting in a more stable estimation of the parameters of the model equation.

Effects of visual information on auditory presence

description.en: The effects of visual information on auditory presence were presented. A segment with a duration of 15 s was used as a stimulus for presentation to a subject for each sound and its corresponding moving picture. The auditory pictures showed a marked change if the corresponding moving picture gave information on the original sound field correctly.

paper_title.en: Psychological factors involved in auditory presence

description.en: The relation between auditory presence and psychological factors of sound perception was discussed. Multiple regression analysis was used to examine the relationship. Sufficient information on sound should be provided to the listener for imaging the original scene naturally and sound sources should be well localized. The effects of visual information clarified the multimodal nature of the impression of presence.

paper_title.en: A database of head-related transfer functions in whole directions on upper hemisphere

description.en: A database of head-related transfer functions (HRTF) covering whole directions in upper hemisphere measured with human subjects in an anechoic room was presented. The HRTF represents the sound pressure at the eardrum of a listener for a specific sound placed in a free field and involves essential information of spatial hearing. The database would contribute to various investigations and applications with regard to spatial hearing and its control. The database is expected to be used for academic purposes and can be downloaded via the Internet.
